body:
That function `AcquireSRWlockExclusive` is only available in windows 2008 or Vista and above, however Go should work with WIndows XP+.

Can you try this binary please?

I compiled it without cgo and therefore without `rclone mount`.

[rclone-v1.36-173-g68333d34.zip](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/files/1075001/rclone-v1.36-173-g68333d34.zip)
Yes, now it works on Win2k3 perfectly!
@billziss-gh do you have an thoughts about this? Is this related to the WinFSP intiialization?

WinFsp uses Vista and higher API's. `AcquireSRWlockExclusive` is only available on Vista and higher as you correctly observe.

However cgofuse does not load the WinFsp DLL unless `Mount` is called. It also loads it dynamically, so that if WinFsp is not installed it will fail gracefully. So it is not immediately obvious to me how WinFsp is responsible for this.

**EDIT**: actually it is cgofuse and not WinFsp that causes the problem:

https://github.com/billziss-gh/cgofuse/blob/master/fuse/host.go#L64

The solution is (likely) to use critical sections instead of slim read/write locks. But does rclone actually still support Windows XP?!
@ncw I can make the necessary changes in cgofuse and you can then pull them. But I have no Windows XP anywhere to test them anymore.

@billziss-gh thanks for looking into this.

I plan to support XP as long as go does.

I don't think we need to support mount on XP though, so would it be possible just to set an unsupported flag in the init which produces an error when mount is called? I'm guessing that wouldn't work unless we dynamically load the AcquireSRWlockExclusive symbol?

Another alternative is I just make a build without mount for XP era Oses and we leave the mount code alone which might be simpler all round.

WinFsp will not load/run on XP, so cgofuse `Mount` will naturally fail. For this to work I will eliminate the slim lock and replace it with a critical section, which exists on XP. I will make this change in the weekend.

I have updated cgofuse to eliminate the dependency on `AcquireSRWlockExclusive `:

https://github.com/billziss-gh/cgofuse/commit/35bcf037030dcadcd247618c75c00c6cd17482d7

However none of the CI services (TravisCI, AppVeyor or CircleCI) have kicked in to test the change. I am not certain why this is the case. Is there some kind of intermittent github issue?

In any case once this is tested I will tag it so you can pull the changes using godep.

**UPDATE**: [GitHub Status](https://status.github.com) reports a "delay in job processing".
All cgofuse tests pass. Latest version of cgofuse has been tagged `v1.0.2`.

Thanks for fixing that @billziss-gh :-)

A beta test which includes those fixes can be found in

https://beta.rclone.org/v1.36-196-g4ce31555/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Please re-open if it doesn't fix the problem.

Thanks

Nick

rclone-v1.36-219-gaa204864-windows-386 and rclone-v1.37-101-g0158ab69-windows-386 fail for me in Windows XP SP2 32-bit with this error:  "The procedure entry point RegGetValueW could not be located in the dynamic link library ADVAPI32.dll".  A bit of googling shows that RegGetValueW is only supported in 64-bit Windows XP.
 
Your rclone-v1.36-173-g68333d34.zip without cgo and therefore without rclone mount works fine.

@balazer thanks for tracking this down.

WinFsp is only supported on Win7+ and (the Windows portion of) cgofuse was written with this in mind. However since rclone supports WinXP, cgofuse should fail gracefully on that platform. We should create a workaround for RegGetValueW in [`FspLoad`](https://github.com/billziss-gh/cgofuse/blob/master/fuse/host.go#L94-L152). If anyone is willing to tackle this I will happily accept a cgofuse PR, or I can look at it when I am back from vacation.
